comments: The real number e^(pi*sqrt(163)) ~ a(0)+1-1/a(2) (cf also the Example section) is called Ramanujan's constant: See the main entry A060295 for further information. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 26 2014
references: H. M. Stark, An Introduction to Number Theory. Markham, Chicago, 1970, p. 179.
links: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
prog: (PARI) default(realprecision,99);contfrac(exp(Pi*sqrt(163))) \\ With standard precision (38 digits), contfrac() returns only [a(0)+1]. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 26 2014
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 07 2000
